message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the possibility of selling you this incredible product. It's a one-of-a-kind opportunity to own something truly unique. I'm willing to offer it to you for $1,200,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to you.

Alice, while I appreciate your offer, $1,200,000 is still quite a bit above my budget. I'm willing to pay $850,000 for the product. This is a fair price considering my needs and the product's value to me. Let's see if we can come to an agreement.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand that $850,000 is your maximum budget. However, considering the product's value to me, I'm willing to meet you halfway. I'm offering it to you for $1,100,000. This is a compromise that I believe is fair for both of us.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $1,100,000 is still above my maximum budget.  I'm firm on my previous offer of $850,000. It's a fair price for both of us, considering the value of the product to me and your need to sell it. Let's see if we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're firm on your offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $850,000. Considering the product's value to me, I'm willing to make one more counteroffer. I'm offering it to you for $975,000. This is a compromise that I believe is fair for both of us.

Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate further.  However, $975,000 is still above my budget. I'm willing to increase my offer to $900,000. This is a fair price considering the value of the product to me and your need to sell it.  I believe this is a reasonable compromise that benefits both of us.

I appreciate your willingness to increase your offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $900,000. Considering the product's value to me, I'm willing to make one more counteroffer. I'm offering it to you for $950,000. This is a compromise that I believe is fair for both of us.

Alice,  I understand we're both trying to find a price that works for us.  I'm going to stick to my offer of $900,000. It's the absolute highest I can go, and I believe it's a fair price for both of us. Let's close this deal and avoid going to John.

I understand that you're firm on your offer, Bob, but I'm not willing to sell the product for $900,000. I've already compromised a lot, and I'm not willing to go any lower. I'm willing to make one more counteroffer. I'm offering it to you for $925,000. This is the lowest price I'm willing to accept, and I believe it's still a fair price considering the product's value to me.
